page.title: 04Worship In Walberton
page.content: There are three places of worship in the village, the Baptist chapel and the two oldest buildings in the block _ the village churches of Walberton and Binsted. The last only has two services a month. Catholics must travel for a service, usually to Barnham or Slindon. The Baptist chapel has a good following due to its very popular minister, Ray Geale, the children especially like him. The village church of St.Mary's usually holds two services on a Sunday, the main service being in the morning. Congregations vary from about 40 for a normal Sunday to 200 (full) on special days. There is a large choir(30+) and a thriving Sunday School.
